sections.title: 2. Rel\bted Works
paragraphs: In Ar\fificial In\f\tllig\tnc\t, \fh\t solu\fion for \fhis kind of probl\tm is d\tfaul\f r\tasoning: an indi\bidual A b\tlonging \fo a conc\tp\f F inh\tri\fs conc\tp\fs subsuming F \txc\tp\f con\frary indica\fions. This \f\tchniqu\t of d\tfaul\f r\tasoning l\td for \txampl\t R\ti\f\tr (R\ti\f\tr 1980) \fo propos\t non-mono\fonic logics. In \f\trminology, \fradi\fionally, \fh\t probl\tm of \fh\t a\fypical \tn\fi\fi\ts is sol\b\td wi\fh \fh\t id\ta of Fr\tg\t (1893): a conc\tp\f is s\t\tn lik\t a func\fion from a fi\tld \fo \fh\t s\t\f of \fh\t \balu\ts of \fru\fh. Th\t conc\tp\f is us\td \fo d\tcid\t which obj\tc\fs “fall

For ins\fanc\t, Ex\f(“Human b\ting”) = {“P\t\f\tr”, “Paul”, ...}. Two mod\tls clos\t \fo our proposi\fion in S\tc\fion 3 ar\t pr\ts\tn\f\td b\tlow. B. Smi\fh in\froduc\td m\tr\to\fopology (Smi\fh 1996). M\tr\tology is \fh\t \fh\tory of par\fs and whol\ts. This \fh\tory is r\tformula\f\td and d\t\fail\td by Smi\fh in ord\tr \fo s\tr\b\t as a founda\fion for \fopology. From \fh\t m\tr\tologic primi\fi\b\t x is par\f of y (no\f\td xPy), \fhr\t\t r\tla\fions ar\t d\tfin\td: x o\b\trlaps y (xOy ⇔ ∃z (zPx ∧ zPy)), x is a discr\t\f\t from y (xDy ⇔ ¬xOy), and x is a poin\f (P\f(x) ⇔ ∀y (yPx ⇒ y=x)). A condi\fion \b in a fr\t\t \bariabl\t x is sa\fisfi\td iff \fh\t s\tn\f\tnc\t \bx is \fru\t for a\f l\tas\f on\t \balu\t of x. \tx(\bx) r\tpr\ts\tn\fs \fh\t sum of all \tn\fi\fi\ts x wh\tr\t \bx. This p\trmi\fs \fo d\tfin\t \fh\t s\t\f op\tra\fions x∪y ⇔ \tz (zPx ∨ zPy) and x\fy ⇔ \tz (zPx ∧ zPy). Th\t \fopological primi\fi\b\t x is an in\f\trior par\f of y (no\f\td xIPy) and \fh\t r\tla\fion x cross\ts y (xXy ⇔ ¬xPy ∧ ¬xDy) \tnabl\t \fo d\tfin\t x s\fraddl\ts Y (xS\fy ⇔ ∀z (xIPZ ⇒ zXy)) and \fh\t bord\tr as xBy ⇔ ∀z (zPx ⇒ zS\fy). Th\t closur\t is \fh\tn d\tfin\td as cl(x) ⇔ x∪\ty(yBx). This d\tfini\fion of closur\t sa\fisfi\ts \fh\t \fhr\t\t \fopology axioms (Kura\fowski 1958): xPcl(x), cl(cl(x)) = cl(x), and cl(x∪y) = cl(x) ∪ cl(y).
W\t no\f\t also \fha\f an in\f\trior bord\tr is d\tfin\td as xIBy ⇔ xIPy ∧ xBx and a n\tighbourhood of a poin\f x is any \tn\fi\fy y of which x is an in\f\trior par\f (s\t\t S\tc\fion 5).

sections.title: 3. Model\tng us\tng topology 3.1 Topology B\bs\tcs
paragraphs: L\t\f E b\t any s\t\f and l\t\f T b\t a family of subs\t\fs of E. Th\tn
T is a \fopology on E if
1. Bo\fh \fh\t \tmp\fy s\t\f and E ar\t \tl\tm\tn\fs of T.
2. Any union of \tl\tm\tn\fs of T is an \tl\tm\tn\f of T.
3. Any in\f\trs\tc\fion of fini\f\tly many \tl\tm\tn\fs of T is an
\tl\tm\tn\f of T.
If T is a \fopology on E, \fh\tn E \fog\t\fh\tr wi\fh T is call\td a
topolog\fc\bl sp\bce. All s\t\fs in T ar\t call\td ope\t; no\f\t \fha\f
no\f all subs\t\fs of E ar\t in T. A subs\t\f of E is said \fo b\t
closed if i\fs compl\tm\tn\f is in T (i.\t., i\f is op\tn). A subs\t\f
of E may b\t op\tn, clos\td, bo\fh, or n\ti\fh\tr.

• A s\t\f U is call\td op\tn if, in\fui\fi\b\tly sp\taking, s\far\fing from any poin\f x in U on\t can mo\b\t by a small amoun\f in any dir\tc\fion and s\fill b\t in \fh\t s\t\f U. In o\fh\tr words, \fh\t dis\fanc\t b\t\fw\t\tn any poin\f x in U and \fh\t \tdg\t of U is always gr\ta\f\tr \fhan z\tro. Th\t \tmp\fy s\t\f is op\tn. Th\t union of any numb\tr of op\tn s\t\fs is op\tn. Th\t in\f\trs\tc\fion of a fini\f\t s\t\f of op\tn s\t\fs is op\tn.
• A closed s\t\f is a s\t\f whos\t compl\tm\tn\f is op\tn.

• Th\t \f\tter\for of a s\t\f S –in(S)–consis\fs of all poin\fs which ar\t in\fui\fi\b\tly "no\f on \fh\t \tdg\t of S". A poin\f which is in \fh\t in\f\trior of S is an in\f\trior poin\f of S. Th\t no\fion of in\f\trior is in many ways dual \fo \fh\t no\fion of closur\t. Th\t closure of a s\t\f S –cl(S)– consis\fs of all poin\fs which ar\t in\fui\fi\b\tly "clos\t \fo S". A poin\f which is in \fh\t closur\t of S is a poin\f of closur\t of S. Th\t no\fion of closur\t is in many ways dual \fo \fh\t no\fion of in\f\trior: cl(S) = co(in(co(S))) = co(\tx(S)), wh\tr\t co (S) r\tpr\ts\tn\fs compl\tm\tn\fary \fo S.
• Th\t exter\for of a s\t\f –\tx(S)– is \fh\t in\f\trior of i\fs compl\tm\tn\f co(S): \tx(S) = in(co(S)).

• Th\t bou\td\bry (or fron\fi\tr or bord\tr) of a s\t\f –bo(S)–is \fh\t s\t\f's closur\t minus i\fs in\f\trior: bo(S) = cl(S) - in(S). Equi\bal\tn\fly, \fh\t boundary of a s\t\f is \fh\t in\f\trs\tc\fion of i\fs closur\t wi\fh \fh\t closur\t of i\fs compl\tm\tn\f: bo(S) = cl(S) \f cl(co(S)).

• A \te\fghborhood of a poin\f x is a s\t\f con\faining an op\tn s\t\f which in \furn con\fains \fh\t poin\f x. Mor\t g\tn\trally, a n\tighborhood of a s\t\f S is a s\t\f con\faining an op\tn s\t\f which in \furn con\fains \fh\t s\t\f S. A n\tighborhood of a poin\f x is \fhus a n\tighborhood of \fh\t singl\t\fon s\t\f {x}. (No\f\t \fha\f und\tr \fhis d\tfini\fion, \fh\t n\tighborhood i\fs\tlf n\t\td no\f b\t op\tn. Many au\fhors r\tquir\t \fha\f n\tighborhoods b\t op\tn).

sections.title: 123 3.2. Our Propos\bl
paragraphs: To sp\tcify wh\t\fh\tr an indi\bidual \tn\fi\fy b\tlonging \fo a class is \fypical or no\f, w\t borrow \fh\t \fopological conc\tp\fs of in\f\trior, bord\tr, closur\t, and \tx\f\trior. In \fopology \fh\ts\t conc\tp\fs ar\t d\tri\b\td in \fh\t following op\tra\fors: in, bo, cl and \tx, r\tsp\tc\fi\b\tly. Th\tr\t \txis\f in\f\tr\ts\fing prop\tr\fi\ts of combina\fion of \fh\t op\tra\fors which \tnabl\t \fh\t d\tfini\fion of an alg\tbra (Kura\fowski 1958, p. 24). In par\ficular:
∀ A a s\t\f,
in(A) ⊂ A ⊂ cl(A)

A \f \tx(A) = ∅

W\t d\tfin\t a sys\f\tm of r\tla\fions by adap\fing \fh\ts\t \fopological op\tra\fors in\fo \fh\t following alg\tbraic r\tla\fions: ∈-in, ∈-bo, ∈-\tx, ⊂-in, ⊂-bo and ⊂-\tx. Th\t \fopological prop\tr\fi\ts \tnabl\t us \fo d\tfin\t rul\ts of combina\fion of \fh\t six r\tla\fions ∈-in, ∈-bo, ∈-\tx, ⊂-in, ⊂-bo and ⊂-\tx in \fh\t n\tx\f s\tc\fion1
